Article Title: Apple's 'Big AI' problem that Google, Microsoft and Amazon do not have to deal with
Article Text:
Google's decades-long head start in AI technology

How Amazon and Microsoft are thriving in this space while Apple is not

How this may be a risk to Apple

While tech giants like Google, Microsoft, and Amazon are advancing rapidly in the AI sector, Apple is reportedly at a disadvantage. Despite its efforts to push forward with AI initiatives, the iPhone maker lacks the essential infrastructure and long-term investment in core AI technologies that its competitors have spent years, if not decades, developing, a new report indicates.For example, Apple delayed its planned overhaul of Siri earlier this year because the upgrade, meant to usher Siri into the generative AI era, wasn‚Äôt ready. According to a report by Business Insider, if Apple wants to modernise Siri to its competitors' levels, it may need to build critical AI components from scratch‚Äîan expensive, time-consuming process that could take years. Otherwise, it may be forced to rely more heavily on competitors or acquire startups at scale to catch up.For having a successful AI product, one needs to have certain AI building blocks. Google already has nearly all the core AI building blocks in place, while Microsoft and Amazon have some of them. Google controls the deep stack of technologies powering its AI building blocks -- data, chips, data centres, cloud business and means to disseminate the products -- which is why it is able to launch AI consumer tools like Veo, Flow, Imagen and so on.In 2017, Google invented Transformer, the breakthrough architecture behind modern generative AI. Tensor Processing Units (TPUs), Google's AI chips, have been around since 2016 and are now integral to both Google products and external developers using Google Cloud.Google also benefits from decades of web indexing and data collection. This immense dataset supports the training of its powerful AI models, datacenters and a cloud business to make these tools available to customers.Both Microsoft and Amazon have some of these building blocks, including AI models, cloud infrastructure, dedicated AI units working on the technology and even partnerships. Apple, on the other hand, lacks many of these assets and doesn't have this kind of access or infrastructure.Apple still doesn't operate enough large-scale data centres and relies on Google data centres for functions like iCloud backups. For recent AI training, Apple even requested access to Google‚Äôs TPUs‚Äîessentially borrowing infrastructure from a direct rival.Reportedly, Apple is also about 7 years behind Google in developing AI chips for data centers. When it comes to data, though Apple has access to huge volumes of data from its devices, it has been conservative in using that data for AI training due to its privacy-first policies. This restricts its ability to build and refine large-scale models.The report also said that Apple has also lagged in recruiting and retaining top AI talent.If generative AI ends up reshaping how people interact with computing devices, including smartphones and laptops, Apple‚Äôs delayed investment in AI infrastructure could become a critical problem. While other tech giants are rolling out robust, end-to-end AI systems, Apple is still piecing together the basic components.
Article Summary: Apple lacks the infrastructure and long-term investment in core AI technologies that its competitors have spent years, if not decades, developing. Google already has nearly all the core AI building blocks in place, while Microsoft and Amazon have some of them. If Apple wants to modernise Siri to its competitors' levels, it may need to build critical AI components from scratch.

Article Title: Elon Musk leaves White House, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella explains why company laid of 6,000 employees, launches from iQoo and Alcatel, and other top news of the week
Article Text:
Elon Musk leaves White House but will remain in advisory role

CEO Satya Nadella on why Microsoft laid off 6000 employees

iQoo Neo 10 launched in India

Alcatel launches its smartphone in India

Walmart job cuts and new hiring plans

Google starts selling Pixel phones from its online store



Hisense unveils E7Q Pro QLED Smart TV

Elon Musk confirmed his departure from the White House, signalling a renewed focus on his ventures like Tesla and SpaceX. Meanwhile, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella addressed the recent layoff of 6,000 employees, clarifying the cuts were due to "reorganisation" rather than performance issues. On the product front, the Indian smartphone witnessed the launch of the gaming-centric iQoo Neo 10, and Alcatel's V3 series. Adding to the retail landscape, Google has finally begun selling its full Pixel lineup directly through its online store in India. All this and other tech news of the week.Elon Musk has left the White House to take care of his companies, including Tesla and SpaceX. Musk expressed gratitude to Trump for the opportunity to lead DOGE, saying, "As my scheduled time as a Special Government Employee comes to an end, I would like to thank President Donald Trump for the opportunity to reduce wasteful spending. The DOGE mission will only strengthen over time as it becomes a way of life throughout the government." Trump also praised Musk saying that the Tesla CEO was "terrific". Read full story here. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella addressed recent job cuts during the company‚Äôs latest Town Hall event with its employees, reportedly revealing that the latest round of job cuts was due to ‚Äúreorganisation rather than performance,‚Äù. This clarification came weeks after it announced plans to lay off 6,000 employees, which is roughly 3% of its workforce. Here's the full story. iQoo Neo 10 was launched in India this week. It is a mid-range smartphone with a focus on gaming performance and battery life. The device is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 8s Gen 4 chipset and has a 7000mAh battery. It is available in multiple RAM and storage configurations, starting at Rs 31,999 for the 8GB + 128GB variant. More details here. Alcatel has launched its smartphones in India. Through a partnership with Nxtcell India, the company launched the V3 series -- including the V3 Classic, V3 Pro, and V3 Ultra -- featuring MediaTek Dimensity 6300 processors and Android 15. The V3 series also showcases Alcatel's patented NXTPAPER display technology. The phones are available on Flipkart starting June 2, 2025. Click here for prices and more specs. Walmart will reportedly introduce ‚Äúseveral hundred new roles‚Äù in the US and India -- days after the company announced to let go of approximately 1,500 employees from its technology department, e-commerce fulfillment centres and the advertising segment named Walmart Connect. Employees who were laid off are eligible to apply for any of these roles. More information here. Google has officially launched direct online sales for its complete Pixel lineup through the Google Store in India. This means consumers can purchase these devices directly from Google. Available products include the Pixel 9a, Pixel 9, Pixel 9 Pro, Pixel 9 Pro XL, Pixel 9 Pro Fold, Pixel 8a, Pixel 8 Pro smartphones, along with Pixel Watch 3, Pixel Buds Pro 2, and official accessories. All details here. Hisense launched its latest Smart TV‚Äîthe Hisense E7Q Pro in India, designed specifically for modern gamers and those seeking a cinematic home entertainment experience. The Hisense E7Q Pro QLED Smart TV is equipped with a high-performance 144Hz refresh rate, Dolby Vision Atmos support, AMD FreeSync Premium certification, and AI Smooth Motion technology. The company claims that the TV can deliver jitter-free visuals and low-latency gaming. Read more for price and features.
Article Summary: iQoo Neo 10 and Alcatel's V3 series launched in India. Elon Musk leaves White House but will remain in advisory role. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella addressed the recent layoff of 6,000 employees. Walmart will reportedly introduce ‚Äòseveral hundred new roles‚Äô in the US and India.

Article Title: Elon Musk responds to what is claimed to be Russia's 'State Secret': Almost all ...
Article Text:
What Mario Nawfal wrote on Russia

RUSSIA‚ÄôS BIRTH RATE JUST FELL TO A 200-YEAR LOW‚ÄîAND NOW IT‚ÄôS A STATE SECRET

Russia is running out of people.

Births dropped so sharply this year that officials stopped publishing monthly numbers. A top demographer says March 2025 may have had the fewest births since the 1700s.

Population projections? Down from 146 million today to 132 million by 2045. Worst-case: just 83 million by 2100.

The government‚Äôs response includes banning ‚Äúchildfree ideology,‚Äù tightening abortion access, offering cash to pregnant women, and even proposing to release prisoners so they can have children.

Also: they might censor TV shows like Harry Potter and Sex and the City for promoting the wrong message.

Source: Newsweek

Elon Musk's reply to Mario Nawfal's post on Russia

Online influencer and founder of IBC Group Mario Nawfal recently shared an excerpt from Newsweek on falling population in Russia. He shared the news excerpt on social media platform, Twitter. Nawfal wrote that Russia's population is at 200-year low and that it is a State Secret. Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk quoted the same and replied that Russia is not an exception in falling birth rate.In his post, quoting Newsweek as source, Nawfal wrote:Quoting Nawfal's post, Elon Musk wrote, "Almost all countries are experiencing birth rate collapse."Incidentally, Elon Musk has raised his concern about falling birth rates in several countries across the world many a times. World's richest man has repeatedly voiced concerns about declining global birth rates, warning that population collapse could be an "existential crisis". He has compared the current trend to the demographic struggles of the Roman Empire and warned that this could lead to the disappearance of civilizations. He has also singled out countries like Singapore, South Korea, and Japan as being particularly vulnerable to population decline.
Article Summary: Mario Nawfal wrote that Russia's population is at 200-year low and that it is a State Secret. Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk quoted the same and replied that Russia is not an exception in falling birth rate. Musk has repeatedly voiced concerns about declining global birth rates, warning that population collapse could be an "existential crisis"

Article Title: Tesla sales crash in Canada's largest province, with sales of these models falling more than 90% in one flat quarter
Article Text:
Tesla models that have seen biggest fall in sales -- Model Y and Model 3

What hurt Tesla -- Rebate freeze, tariffs and ...

Tesla‚Äôs electric vehicle (EV) sales have hit a rough patch, with a dramatic decline not only in Europe but now in Canada, particularly in Qu√©bec, during the first quarter of 2025. According to a Business Insider report citing data from Qu√©bec‚Äôs vehicle registration authority, only 524 new Teslas were registered in the province from January to March 2025‚Äîa staggering 85% drop from the 5,097 vehicles registered in the final quarter of 2024.The Tesla Model Y, the company‚Äôs best-selling vehicle, saw registrations plummet to just 360 units in the first quarter of 2025, down from 3,274 in the fourth quarter of 2024 -- a decline of nearly 89%. The Model 3, Tesla‚Äôs most affordable offering, fared even worse, with registrations falling 94% to a mere 96 units from 1,786 in the previous quarter. These figures highlight a significant setback for Tesla in a key Canadian market.While automotive sales often dip at the start of the year, Quebec's numbers reflect a far steeper decline than typical seasonal trends. This downturn mirrors Tesla‚Äôs struggles in Europe, where sales dropped nearly 50% in April 2025 despite growing overall EV demand, according to Business Insider. The global pattern suggests Tesla may be grappling with broader challenges, including intensified competition from Chinese EV makers like BYD and shifting consumer preferences toward hybrid vehicles.A major factor in Tesla‚Äôs Quebec's slump appears to be the Canadian government‚Äôs sudden suspension of $43 million in federal EV rebates in March 2025. The freeze followed a suspicious surge in Tesla rebate applications, which skyrocketed from 300 to nearly 5,800 per day, prompting a formal review. Business Insider reports that Transport Minister Chrystia Freeland has stated Tesla will remain ineligible for future incentives as long as U.S. President Donald Trump‚Äôs 25% tariffs on Canadian goods persist, further complicating Tesla‚Äôs market position.Beyond rebates and tariffs, Tesla faces growing competition in Canada from domestic and international EV manufacturers offering more affordable models. For instance, companies like Rivian and VinFast have introduced competitively priced EVs, while legacy automakers like Toyota and Ford are gaining traction with hybrid options. Tesla‚Äôs pricing strategy, which has seen multiple cuts in recent years, may also be eroding its brand premium, making it harder to maintain market share in cost-sensitive regions like Qu√©bec.
Article Summary: Only 524 new Teslas were registered in the province from January to March 2025. A major factor in Tesla‚Äôs Quebec's slump appears to be the Canadian government's sudden suspension of $43 million in federal EV rebates. Tesla faces growing competition in Canada from domestic and international EV manufacturers offering more affordable models.

Article Title: Google says it will appeal court's decision in Search case: Read company's 6-point response to remedies proposed by justice department
Article Text:
What remedies DOJ has demanded and what the judge said



The DOJ‚Äôs proposed remedies go miles beyond...: Google

Yesterday, we made closing arguments in the DOJ search remedies trial. The DOJ‚Äôs proposed remedies go miles beyond the Court‚Äôs decision & would harm consumers, businesses and America‚Äôs tech leadership. Here are a few key points from our arguments. ‚¨áÔ∏è

1/ DOJ waved off very real privacy issues, saying they‚Äôd be resolved later on. In fact, one DOJ lawyer said ‚Äúthe only thing we can do is give [rivals] more data.‚Äù ü§î

2/ When confronted with significant questions left open by their proposals (i.e. how much data should Google be forced to share?), DOJ just said it could all be worked out by a ‚ÄúTechnical Committee‚Äù of mostly govt-appointed experts.

3/ The DOJ‚Äôs proposal reserves the right for the government to decide who gets Google users‚Äô data. Not the Court.

4/ The DOJ spent many hours trying to convince the Court to remake the tech sector. Meanwhile it‚Äôs very clear the AI space is highly competitive today: Countless rivals in the AI space are growing fast & gaining users & distribution without government intervention.

5/ While we heard a lot about how the remedies would help various well-funded competitors (w/ repeated references to Bing), we heard very little about how all this helps consumers.

6/ We will wait for the Court‚Äôs opinion. And we still strongly believe the Court‚Äôs original decision was wrong, and look forward to our eventual appeal.

Powerbeats Pro 2 ‚Äì Apple‚Äôs Most Powerful Workout Buds Yet!
Article Summary: The DOJ‚Äôs proposed remedies go miles beyond...: Google. DOJ waved off very real privacy issues, saying they‚Äôd be resolved later on. While we heard a lot about how the remedies would help various well-funded competitors, we heard very little about how all this helps consumers.

Article Title: WhatsApp will not work on these iPhones and Android smartphones after May 31, check if yours is in the list
Article Text:
List of iPhones WhatsApp will stop working on

iPhone 5s

iPhone 6

iPhone 6 Plus

Android smartphones that will lose WhatsApp support from June 1

Why WhatsApp will stop working on these devices

What users of smartphones on which WhatsApp will stop working can do



Starting this Sunday, June 1, 2025, WhatsApp, the Meta-owned messaging platform, will stop support for several older smartphone models as part of its routine update cycle. This change, initially scheduled for May 5, 2025, was delayed by a few weeks to allow users additional time to prepare. The update raises the app‚Äôs minimum system requirements, rendering it incompatible with certain legacy devices.WhatsApp will require iOS 15.1 or later for iPhones and Android 5.1 or higher for Android devices. As a result, the following iPhone models will no longer support WhatsApp:These models are limited to iOS versions below 15.1, making them incompatible with the updated app. However, some reports have mistakenly included the iPhone 6s, iPhone 6s Plus, and iPhone SE (1st generation) in the affected list. These devices can run iOS 15.8.4, the latest supported version for them, and should remain compatible with WhatsApp until a future update raises requirements again, likely not for another one to two years.On the Android side, devices running Android 5.0 (Lollipop) or earlier will also lose support. This includes older models like the Samsung Galaxy S3, HTC One X, and Sony Xperia Z, though specific Android model lists vary due to the platform‚Äôs fragmentation.WhatsApp periodically updates its minimum requirements to leverage newer operating system features, enhance security, and optimize performance. Older devices, often limited by hardware constraints, struggle to support modern app functionalities like end-to-end encryption, video calling, or new interface elements. By dropping support for outdated systems, WhatsApp ensures a consistent user experience across its approximately 3 billion global users.If you or someone you know uses an affected device, here are your options:* Upgrade the Device: Switching to a newer smartphone supporting iOS 15.1 or Android 5.1 (or later) will ensure continued access to WhatsApp. Budget-friendly options like the iPhone SE (2nd or 3rd generation) or mid-range Android devices are widely available.* Update iOS (if possible): For devices like the iPhone 6s, 6s Plus, or SE (1st gen), ensure the device is updated to iOS 15.8.4 via Settings > General > Software Update to maintain compatibility.* Switch to Alternatives: Other messaging apps like Telegram or Signal may still support older devices, though their user bases are smaller. Check their respective app stores for compatibility.* Backup Chats: Before losing access, back up WhatsApp conversations to iCloud (iPhone) or Google Drive (Android) to transfer them to a new device. Go to WhatsApp Settings > Chats > Chat Backup to secure your data.This change aligns with industry trends, as apps increasingly phase out support for older systems. Apple‚Äôs own data from 2024 indicates that only about 5% of active iPhones run iOS 15 or earlier, suggesting limited impact in developed markets. However, users in regions with slower device turnover may face challenges. WhatsApp has advised affected users to upgrade devices by June 1, 2025, to avoid service disruptions.For more details, visit WhatsApp‚Äôs official support page or check your device‚Äôs compatibility in the App Store or Google Play Store. If you‚Äôre unsure about your device‚Äôs status, you can verify its iOS version under Settings > General > About on iPhone or Settings > About Phone on Android.
Article Summary: WhatsApp will stop working on several older smartphone models on June 1, 2025. The update raises the app‚Äôs minimum system requirements, rendering it incompatible with certain legacy devices. Affected users are advised to upgrade devices by June 1 to avoid service disruptions.

Article Title: NYT Connections hints and answers for today (May 30, 2025)
Article Text:
What is NYT Connections?



How to play NYT Connections

Hints for today‚Äôs NYT Connections (30 May)

Yellow group ‚Äì These are all types of rods

Green group ‚Äì Items that usually come in rolls

Blue group ‚Äì Items commonly handed out as promotional freebies

Purple group ‚Äì Words that can come before ‚Äúshack‚Äù in popular phrases or names

Answers for today‚Äôs Connections (30 May)

Explanation of today‚Äôs answers

NYT Connections is back with another puzzle. If you are scratching your head trying to figure out today‚Äôs NYT Connections puzzle, you are not alone. The popular New York Times word game has become a daily ritual for fans of quick-thinking and pattern-spotting. Today‚Äôs challenge for 30 May 2025 comes with its own twists, but worry not ‚Äì we have gathered all the clues, solutions and explanations you need to solve it. Whether you are a first-time player or on a winning streak, this guide will walk you through how to play, hints for today‚Äôs groups, the correct answers and their connections.NYT Connections is a daily word puzzle game offered by The New York Times . It presents players with a 4x4 grid of 16 seemingly unrelated words. The goal is to organise them into four groups of four words that are connected by a common theme or idea. These themes can range from synonyms and item categories to clever wordplay and pop culture references. The game tests not just vocabulary, but lateral thinking as well.Playing Connections is simple but tricky. You start with a grid of 16 words. Your task is to group the words into four sets of four that share a common link. These links can be literal, metaphorical, or based on word associations. Once you select a group of four words, hit the 'Submit' button. If correct, that group is removed from the board. You only get four chances to make mistakes, so choose wisely. The four categories are colour-coded by difficulty: yellow (easiest), green, blue, and purple (hardest).To help you solve today‚Äôs puzzle, here are the theme hints for each of the four groups:Yellow group ‚Äì Rods: BAT, CLUB, STAFF, STICKGreen group ‚Äì They‚Äôre on a roll!: FOIL, RIBBON, TAPE, TOILET PAPERBlue group ‚Äì Common swag items: HAT, TEE, TOTE, WATER BOTTLEPurple group ‚Äì Words before "shack": CADDY, LOVE, RADIO, SHAKEThe yellow group contains items that are types of rods or handheld sticks, such as a bat for baseball or a staff often used in hiking or fantasy tales.The green group are all objects that are typically rolled up. Toilet paper, foil, ribbon, and tape are all stored and dispensed from rolls, making the connection logical and physical.The blue group includes popular promotional items. If you've attended any conference or corporate event, you‚Äôve likely come home with a hat, tee, tote bag, or water bottle emblazoned with a company logo.The purple group is a fun wordplay category. Each word can be paired with ‚Äúshack‚Äù to form a well-known term or brand: Caddyshack (film), Love Shack (song by The B-52‚Äôs), RadioShack (retail chain), and Shake Shack (restaurant chain).Today‚Äôs puzzle was a satisfying mix of straightforward connections and clever wordplay. The trickiest part was arguably the purple group, but once ‚ÄúRadio‚Äù and ‚ÄúShake‚Äù were spotted, the pattern clicked into place. Whether you solved it quickly or needed some nudges, remember each day brings a new challenge. Come back tomorrow for another round of mental gymnastics. Happy Connection!
Article Summary: NYT Connections is a daily word puzzle game offered by The New York Times. It presents players with a 4x4 grid of 16 seemingly unrelated words. The goal is to organise them into four groups of four words that are connected by a common theme.

Article Title: Mark Zuckerberg‚Äôs Meta seeks mid-trial dismissal of FTC antitrust battle
Article Text:
Mark Zuckerberg‚Äôs Meta seeks mid-trial dismissal of FTC antitrust battle

New York Post

Meta's legal push to dismiss the FTC case

FTC‚Äôs case against Meta: A 'buy or bury' strategy

Meta‚Äôs defense strategy and internal turmoil

Mark Zuckerberg takes the stand as FTC trial continues

What comes next for Meta

Also read | AI software development agent Codex released by OpenAI in ChatGPT

Meta , the tech giant behind Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, has requested a federal judge to dismiss the Federal Trade Commission‚Äôs (FTC) high-profile antitrust case, just as the trial approaches a critical phase. According to the, the case, which began in early April, represents one of the most significant regulatory challenges faced by Meta in its history, potentially resulting in the breakup of the company‚Äôs social media empire.Meta's move to dismiss the case comes after the FTC rested its side of the argument, asserting that the company holds an illegal monopoly over the social networking market, particularly those platforms focused on friends-and-family connections. Meta, however, argues that the FTC's case is based on a flawed market definition and ignores the intense competition it faces from newer platforms like TikTok, YouTube, and Elon Musk‚Äôs X (formerly known as Twitter).In a court filing late Thursday, Meta reiterated its stance that the FTC has failed to meet the legal standards required to prove its antitrust allegations. The company‚Äôs legal team argues that the FTC has fundamentally mischaracterized the social media market, claiming that the agency's definition is overly narrow and excludes significant competitors.‚ÄúAfter five weeks of trial, it is clear that the FTC has failed to meet the legal standard required under antitrust law,‚Äù a Meta spokesperson said in a statement on Friday. ‚ÄúRegardless, we will present our case to show what every 17-year-old in the world knows: Instagram competes with TikTok (and YouTube and X and many other apps).‚ÄùMeta claims that it faces substantial competition from a wide range of digital platforms, including short-video giant TikTok, video-sharing platform YouTube, and Elon Musk‚Äôs X. These platforms, Meta argues, all compete for user engagement, advertising revenue, and market share, undercutting the FTC‚Äôs claim that Meta has maintained an unlawful monopoly.The FTC‚Äôs antitrust lawsuit, which was first filed in December 2020, centers on Meta‚Äôs acquisitions of Instagram in 2012 and WhatsApp in 2014. The agency claims that Meta pursued a deliberate ‚Äúbuy or bury‚Äù strategy, acquiring these fast-growing competitors to neutralize potential threats to its dominant position in the social networking market.In its filing, the FTC pointed to internal Meta communications as evidence of this strategy. This includes a 2012 email from Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg suggesting that buying Instagram would ‚Äúneutralize a competitor.‚Äù The FTC further argues that these acquisitions reduced consumer choice and stifled innovation, limiting competition in the rapidly evolving social media industry.The FTC's case aims to convince U.S. District Judge James Boasberg to order Meta to spin off Instagram and WhatsApp, effectively dismantling the company's integrated social media ecosystem.Meta's defense in the trial has focused on presenting itself as a company that supports innovation and benefits consumers. In its Thursday filing, the company argued that its acquisition of Instagram enabled massive growth, which in turn delivered significant benefits to users.‚ÄúMeta‚Äôs acquisition of Instagram enabled massive growth ‚Äì with correspondingly massive benefits for US consumers,‚Äù the company stated in its court filing.However, the trial has also brought to light internal documents that may complicate Meta‚Äôs defense. For instance, a 2018 email from an unnamed Instagram executive warned that "fake engagement could be in the range of 40%," potentially undermining Meta's claims about the platform‚Äôs integrity and user trust.Mark Zuckerberg himself was the first witness called by the FTC as the trial opened, highlighting the personal stakes for the Meta CEO. During his testimony, Zuckerberg sought to portray Meta as a company facing fierce competition, rather than a monopoly crushing potential rivals.Earlier in the trial, Instagram co-founder Kevin Systrom testified that he felt Zuckerberg viewed Instagram‚Äôs rapid growth as a potential threat to Facebook‚Äôs dominance after the acquisition, further fueling the FTC‚Äôs argument that Meta's mergers were designed to stifle competition.The 10-week non-jury trial, which is expected to conclude in June, will be followed by final briefs from both the FTC and Meta. If Judge Boasberg sides with the FTC, a second trial will be held to determine appropriate remedies, potentially including the forced divestiture of Instagram and WhatsApp.Meta will continue presenting its defense when the trial resumes on Monday. The company‚Äôs attempt to dismiss the case outright remains a long shot, as the judge may choose to let the case proceed to its scheduled conclusion before issuing a ruling.
Article Summary: The FTC's antitrust lawsuit centers on Meta‚Äôs acquisitions of Instagram in 2012 and WhatsApp in 2014. The agency claims that Meta pursued a deliberate ‚Äúbuy or bury‚Äù strategy, acquiring these fast-growing competitors to neutralize potential threats to its dominant position in the social networking market. Meta argues that the FTC's case is based on a flawed market definition and ignores the intense competition it faces.

Article Title: NYT Strands today: Clues, answers, Spangram for May 30, 2025
Article Text:
NYT Strands May 30 2025 ‚Äì Hints, answers, Spangram



Today's NYT Strands puzzle theme

'These words are common positions in sports.'



Hints for today‚Äôs Strands



Hints

Spangram for today

Soccer



Today's Strands‚Äô answers:

Midfielder

Striker

Goalkeeper

Soccer

Defender

Forward

What are NYT Strands and how to play the game?

Tips for solving NYT Strands puzzle



The New York Times published its inaugural crossword puzzle on February 15, 1942, in the Sunday Magazine. Created by Charles Erlenkotter and edited by Margaret Farrar, it was the first major newspaper to feature a crossword puzzle. Over the years, the NYT has introduced several beloved games, including the Mini Crossword in 2014, followed by Spelling Bee, Letter Boxed, and Tiles. In 2022, the NYT launched the wildly popular Wordle, followed by additional games like Connections and Strands.NYT Strands is the latest addition to its puzzle offerings. This engaging daily game presents players with new themes each day, challenging them to uncover all the words on the grid. One of the game‚Äôs highlights is the special Spangram, which stretches across two sides of the board. With its innovative approach to word puzzles, Strands quickly became a fan favorite, adding to the diverse and exciting puzzle lineup of the New York Times.Having trouble solving today‚Äôs NYT Strands puzzle? We‚Äôre here to help with some easy hints to fuel your curiosity even more. Plus, we‚Äôve got today‚Äôs answer waiting for you ‚Äì just keep reading.The theme for today‚Äôs Strands isBelow, we‚Äôve shared the hints, answers, and Spangram for today‚Äôs NYT Strands puzzle. The hints may give away part or all of the Strands, so proceed with caution. Scroll down to continue:Hint #1: The game where goals, glory, and passion unite on a grassy pitchHint #2: Eleven players, one ball, and ninety minutes of non-stop action around the world.is the Spangram for today‚Äôs NYT Strands puzzle.Strands is a puzzle game that blends elements of Connections, Spelling Bee, and classic crossword puzzles. Players are given 48 letters arranged on a 6 x 8-inch grid, along with a daily theme. The goal is to solve the Spangram and uncover all the theme-related words.To play, connect letters on the grid to form words by dragging your mouse or fingers (on a touchscreen) in horizontal, vertical, or diagonal directions.Start by identifying the central theme word or Spangram, which will help you understand the puzzle‚Äôs theme.In addition to the Spangram, you must also find other words related to the theme hidden in the grid. Once you‚Äôve uncovered them all, the puzzle is complete.Identify the theme words: Fill in the grid with the theme words. Once found, they will be highlighted in blue and won't overlap with each other.Find the Spangram: Identify the Spangram, a key part of the puzzle that connects two opposite sides of the grid. It encapsulates the theme and may consist of two words. The Spangram will be highlighted in yellow once you‚Äôve located it.Take advantage of hints: Pay attention to off-topic words for clues. For every three non-theme words you uncover, letters will be highlighted to give you a hint toward finding a theme word, without directly revealing it.
Article Summary: Strands is a puzzle game that blends elements of Connections, Spelling Bee, and classic crossword puzzles. Players are given 48 letters arranged on a 6 x 8-inch grid, along with a daily theme. The goal is to solve the Spangram and uncover all the theme-related words.

Article Title: Jeff Bezos‚Äô $165 billion divorce lesson: New bride Lauren gets prenup, not Amazon shares
Article Text:
Jeff Bezos‚Äô $165 billion divorce lesson: New bride Lauren gets prenup, not Amazon shares

Bezos‚Äô divorce bombshell: How a missing prenup created a $35 billion settlement

Bezos‚Äô new romance, new rules: The $220 billion prenup strategy

Inside the billion-dollar prenup: Legal experts weigh in

When Jeff Bezos married MacKenzie Scott in 1993, few could have predicted the trajectory of their lives. At the time, Amazon was a fledgling online bookstore operating from a garage, and the tech boom that would make Bezos one of the richest people in history was still years away. Their 25-year marriage not only survived Amazon's meteoric rise but also played a crucial role in shaping one of the most iconic business empires of the 21st century. Yet, despite the immense wealth they amassed, the couple entered their union without a prenuptial agreement‚Äîa decision that would reverberate globally after their 2019 divorce.MacKenzie walked away with a 4% stake in Amazon, instantly catapulting her into the ranks of the world's richest women. As of 2025, Forbes estimates her net worth to be around $165.3 billion. That highly publicized split not only altered the tech landscape but also sparked renewed conversations about asset protection in high-net-worth marriages.Now, with Jeff Bezos preparing to marry his fianc√©e Lauren S√°nchez, a former TV anchor and entrepreneur, he appears to be approaching marriage with a new playbook. Legal insiders and wealth advisors reveal that this time, Bezos has opted for a comprehensive, multi-jurisdictional prenuptial agreement ‚Äî a far cry from the informal beginning of his first marriage.Jeff and MacKenzie Scott met in the early 1990s when they were both working at hedge fund D.E. Shaw. The couple moved to Seattle, where Bezos launched Amazon in 1994 with MacKenzie as one of the earliest employees. Their professional and personal lives were deeply intertwined, and as the company flourished, so did their financial fortune. MacKenzie played a key role in Amazon‚Äôs early operations, even helping with the company‚Äôs initial business plan. Their shared vision laid the foundation for what would become one of the most valuable companies in the world.However, when they announced their divorce in 2019, one crucial detail became the focus: the absence of a prenuptial agreement. As a result, under Washington state‚Äôs community property laws, MacKenzie was entitled to half of all marital assets ‚Äî including a significant portion of Bezos‚Äô Amazon shares.Ultimately, she walked away with 25% of their shared Amazon holdings, equivalent to about 4% of the company‚Äôs total shares at the time. That stake alone was valued at approximately $35 billion when the settlement was finalized, though her net worth has since grown due to stock value increases and philanthropic activities.Bezos' new relationship with Lauren S√°nchez, which began publicly in 2019 shortly after his divorce, has been markedly different. S√°nchez, a media personality, helicopter pilot, and founder of Black Ops Aviation, has her own career and public profile. However, the wealth disparity between the two is massive. Bezos, with a net worth of around $220 billion, remains one of the top three richest individuals globally.This stark financial imbalance has prompted Bezos to take a vastly different approach in his second marriage ‚Äî one focused on legal precision, asset protection, and long-term planning.According to Certified Family Law Specialist Alphonse Provinziano, Bezos' prenuptial agreement with S√°nchez is likely airtight. Speaking to HELLO!, Provinziano noted that such agreements in ultra-high-net-worth marriages typically involve extensive documentation of separate property and future earnings exclusions. These agreements are meticulously crafted with the input of top legal and financial experts. They aim to preemptively resolve disputes that could arise from complex asset portfolios.‚ÄúThere would be a clear enumeration of all business assets and ownership interests, stating these would be considered Jeff Bezos' separate property,‚Äù he explained.In other words, S√°nchez would not be entitled to any share of Amazon, Blue Origin, The Washington Post, or any related entities regardless of how long the marriage lasts ‚Äî unless otherwise stipulated.These prenups often include clauses preventing spouses from claiming business appreciation, intellectual property growth, or share in future ventures unless there‚Äôs joint investment or involvement. They may even have confidentiality clauses and non-disparagement agreements to avoid post-divorce public disputes. Such terms are common in celebrity or high-profile marriages to maintain reputational integrity. They reflect a broader trend of legal foresight among billionaires seeking long-term asset protection.
Article Summary: Jeff Bezos and MacKenzie Scott divorced in 2019 after 25 years of marriage. The couple had entered their union without a prenuptial agreement. As a result, under Washington state‚Äôs community property laws, MacK McKenzie was entitled to half of all marital assets ‚Äî including a significant portion of Bezos‚Äô Amazon shares. Bezos, with a net worth of around $220 billion, remains one of the top three richest individuals globally.

Article Title: Now Elon Musk is pissed and ... , says angry Laura Loomer on Republicans for tiff with Tesla CEO
Article Text:
iPhone 16e: 5 Reasons to buy the most affordable iPhone 16 series model!

Laura Loomer has slammed the Republican Party for driving away Elon Musk , whom she termed as ‚Äútheir biggest donor‚Äù. In a post on social media X, Loomer criticized Republican Party, popularly known as Grand Old Party ( GOP ) for failing to codify spending cuts proposed under Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE). She further suggested that their inaction may have cost them critical support ahead of the upcoming midterm elections.‚ÄúLeave it to the GOP to push their biggest donor away,‚Äù Loomer wrote. ‚ÄúAll they had to do was codify the DOGE cuts and they could have had unlimited funding for the midterms. They somehow managed to F that up,‚Äù she added.In her post, Loomer was referring to Musk‚Äôs recent announcement to step down from DOGE and his advisory role in the Trump administration. The Tesla CEO has been leading the DOGE task force to cut federal waste and streamlining government spending. He later expressed public disappointment over the ‚ÄúOne Big Beautiful Bill Act,‚Äù which failed to reflect the aggressive cuts he had championed.‚ÄúNow @elonmusk is pissed and walking away. Can‚Äôt really blame him,‚Äù Loomer added.Musk‚Äôs departure marks a significant shift for the GOP, which has leaned heavily on his financial and technological influence in recent years. With the midterms approaching and party divisions deepening, Loomer‚Äôs post reflects a growing frustration among right-wing influencers over what they see as a squandered opportunity to secure both policy wins and campaign funding.The post comes amid rising tensions between Musk and some of Trump‚Äôs top advisers, including those who publicly defended the controversial spending bill.
Article Summary: Laura Loomer has slammed the Republican Party for driving away Elon Musk, whom she termed as ‚Äòtheir biggest donor‚Äô In a post on social media X, she criticized Republican Party, popularly known as Grand Old Party ( GOP ) for failing to codify spending cuts proposed under Department of Government Efficiency.

Article Title: Duolingo CEO Luis von Ahn makes a prediction on how AI will change schools in future
Article Text:
Duolingo CEO Luis von Ahn feels that AI will take over teaching



Schools won‚Äôt disappear, but their role will change: Duolingo CEO Luis von Ahn



Duolingo CEO Luis von Ann recently predicted that artificial intelligence (AI) will fundamentally transform education, shifting the role of schools from traditional learning institutions to childcare and supervised spaces. As reported by Business Insider, speaking at the No Priors podcast, von Ahn stressed on the fact that AI‚Äôs scalability makes it more efficient than human teachers and it can be easily used for personalised education. "Education is going to change. It's just a lot more scalable to teach with AI than with teachers,‚Äù von Ahn said.Von Ahn suggests that AI will increasingly handle the core instruction in schools. He believes that AI can deliver personalised education more effectively than traditional classroom models with teachers. AI system can be designed to precisely track individual student progress, identify areas where they struggle and then tailor the learning experience accordingly.While Von Ahn does not believe schools will vanish, he foresees a future where AI tutors handle most of the teaching, while schools primarily serve as safe environments for children. He explained that AI can track individual student performance in real time, adjusting lesson plans to match each child‚Äôs learning pace‚Äîsomething human teachers struggle to do in large classrooms.‚ÄúThat doesn't mean the teachers are going to go away. You still need people to take care of the students. I also don't think schools are going to go away because you still need childcare,‚Äù von Ahn said on the podcast.This doesn't mean teachers will become obsolete, according to von Ahn. Instead, their responsibilities may evolve. Teachers could transition from primarily delivering instruction to supervising students, providing guidance, and fostering social and emotional development.Von Ahn also points out that the integration of AI in education is already happening. Duolingo, for example, is restructuring its operations to embrace an "AI-first" approach. This includes using AI for tasks previously done by contractors and incorporating AI into employee performance reviews.
Article Summary: Duolingo CEO Luis von Ahn predicts that AI will transform education. He believes that AI can deliver personalised education more effectively than traditional classroom models with teachers. AI system can be designed to precisely track individual student progress, identify areas where they struggle and then tailor the learning experience accordingly.

Article Title: Why X's mother Grimes is not happy with Elon Musk taking their son everywhere: This ...
Article Text:
Elon Musk‚Äôs ex-girlfriend Grimes‚Äô concerns over X‚Äôs exposure

Elon Musk used drugs during the 2024 campaign

Tesla CEO Elon Musk‚Äôs ex-girlfriend and Canadian musician Grimes, has raised concerns over Musk‚Äôs frequent public appearances with their 5-year-old son, X √Ü A-Xii, arguing that it violates their custody settlement. Grimes‚Äô comments came in response to a recent New York Times report which cited that she has been fighting with Elon Musk over their 5-year-old son, known as X.As per NYT‚Äôs report, Grimes and Musk had previously agreed to keep their children out of the public eye. However, Musk has repeatedly brought X to high-profile events, including Oval Office meetings and political gatherings, which are widely broadcast.Grimes has privately expressed worries about X‚Äôs safety, stating that frequent travel and sleep deprivation could negatively impact his health and well-being.Grimes is not the only woman challenging Musk over parental rights. Ashley St. Clair, a conservative writer, recently revealed that she had a secret relationship with Musk and gave birth to his 14th known child. She claims Musk offered her a large settlement to keep his paternity concealed, but she refused.Musk later sought a gag order in New York to prevent St. Clair from speaking publicly about their child, according to her statements.Musk‚Äôs behaviour and personal decisions have drawn criticism from former associates, including neuroscientist Philip Low, who accused him of pushing the boundaries of bad behaviour.The same NYT report also revealed that US President Donald Trump has confirmed that he was not aware of Tesla CEO Elon Musk regularly using drugs during the 2024 presidential campaign.The NYT report also noted that it was unclear whether Musk used drugs while potentially working for Trump in a proposed Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE). Speaking to reporters after returning from a rally in Pennsylvania (as noted by USA Today), Trump denied having any knowledge of Musk‚Äôs drug usage during the campaign ahead of the 2024 US elections.When asked if the report bothered him, Trump replied, ‚ÄúI'm not troubled by anything with Elon.‚Äù Moreover, he described the ex-DOGE leader as "fantastic.‚Äù
Article Summary: Elon Musk‚Äôs ex-girlfriend and Canadian musician Grimes, has raised concerns over Musk's frequent public appearances with their 5-year-old son, X √Ü A-Xii. Grimes argues that it violates their custody settlement. US President Donald Trump has confirmed that he was not aware of Tesla CEO Elon Musk regularly using drugs during the 2024 presidential campaign.

Article Title: Donald Trump on if he was aware of Elon Musk using drugs during the 2024 campaign: I am ...
Article Text:
‚ÄúI'm not troubled by anything with Elon.‚Äù

"fantastic.‚Äù

Musk‚Äôs Downfall Blamed on Drugs? Tesla Boss LAUGHS Off Wild Report | WATCH

What we know about Elon Musk's history of using drugs



‚ÄúLet‚Äôs move on,‚Äù

Powerbeats Pro 2 ‚Äì Apple‚Äôs Most Powerful Workout Buds Yet!

US President Donald Trump has confirmed that he was not aware of Tesla CEO Elon Musk regularly using drugs during the 2024 presidential campaign . Trump's comments came in response to a recent New York Times report that cited unnamed sources to allege that the tech billionaire frequently used drugs such as ketamine, ecstasy and psychedelic mushrooms while being involved in presidential campaigning efforts with Trump last year. The NYT report also noted that it was unclear whether Musk used drugs while potentially working for Trump in a proposed Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE). Speaking to reporters after returning from a rally in Pennsylvania (as noted by USA Today), Trump denied having any knowledge of Musk‚Äôs drug usage during the campaign ahead of the 2024 US elections.When asked if the report bothered him, Trump replied,Moreover, he described the ex-DOGE leader asDuring a recent Oval Office event, a reporter also attempted to question Musk about alleged drug use during the 2024 campaign, USA Today reported. However, the billionaire sidestepped the inquiry and instead criticised The New York Times‚Äô coverage of Russian interference in the 2016 election.he said, standing behind President Trump at the Resolute Desk.In March 2024, he admitted to using prescribed ketamine to treat periods of depression and concerned corporate leaders by smoking marijuana on a 2018 podcast.The NYT report claimed that Musk carries a daily pillbox with about 20 medications, including Adderall, stimulants, and psychedelics. The report‚Äôs sources alleged that he used ketamine often, sometimes daily, and combined it with other drugs.He has also reportedly partaken in Ecstasy and magic mushrooms at private events, reflecting a broader history of recreational drug use.
Article Summary: US President Donald Trump confirmed that he was not aware of Tesla CEO Elon Musk regularly using drugs during the 2024 presidential campaign. Trump's comments came in response to a recent New York Times report that cited unnamed sources to allege that the tech billionaire frequently used drugs such as ketamine, ecstasy and psychedelic mushrooms.

Article Title: X outage: Here‚Äôs how to get DMs, posts, and replies working again on Twitter
Article Text:
X outage: Here‚Äôs how to Get DMs, posts, and replies working again on Twitter

X outage today: What went wrong

1. Scope and timeline of X outage

Users across the US, Canada, UK, Germany, India, and Brazil reported problems.

Reports to Downdetector spiked from under 500 to over 35,000 in less than an hour.

Key features such as posting new content, replying to existing posts, and sending/receiving DMs were either severely delayed or entirely non-functional.

2. Impacted features

Posts/tweets: Posts were delayed by several minutes or failed to upload altogether.

Posts were delayed by several minutes or failed to upload altogether. Replies: Users could not reply to threads, or replies would disappear after posting.

Users could not reply to threads, or replies would disappear after posting. DMs: Direct messages failed to send, or sent messages showed no delivery status.

Direct messages failed to send, or sent messages showed no delivery status. Notifications: Some users stopped receiving engagement notifications (likes, follows, mentions).

3. Possible technical causes

Server overload or maintenance glitch : Background server updates or auto-scaling failures could have disrupted real-time API services.

: Background server updates or auto-scaling failures could have disrupted real-time API services. Cloud infrastructure issues : Since X operates on a mix of on-premise and third-party cloud services (rumored to include AWS and Oracle), latency or misconfiguration in cloud clusters could result in service-wide failures.

: Since X operates on a mix of on-premise and third-party cloud services (rumored to include AWS and Oracle), latency or misconfiguration in cloud clusters could result in service-wide failures. Database lock or caching failures : A malfunction in Redis or Cassandra-based caches could temporarily prevent data from propagating through the system.

: A malfunction in Redis or Cassandra-based caches could temporarily prevent data from propagating through the system. Rate limiting algorithm errors: Over-aggressive rate limiting (a system used to prevent spam) may have mistakenly restricted normal user actions during peak usage.

User reactions across platforms on X outage

Reddit (particularly /r/Twitter and /r/TechNews)

Facebook and Instagram (with hashtags like #TwitterDown and #XNotWorking)

Threads, Meta‚Äôs rival platform, saw a temporary spike in new users and activity during the outage.

What users can do when X is down: Easy fixes for posts, replies and messages



1. Confirm the outage

Visit Downdetector (https://downdetector.com/status/twitter/) to verify if the issue is affecting others.

Check X‚Äôs status page if available, though it is often outdated.

Look for trending tags like #XDown or #TwitterOutage on platforms like Reddit or Threads.

2. Refresh and retry

Posts and replies



Refresh the X page or relaunch the app.



Wait a few minutes before attempting to post or reply again.

Direct Messages (DMs)

Fully close and reopen the app.



Retry sending the message; many users report intermittent functionality.

3. Clear cache and cookies

On browser:



Go to Settings > Privacy > Clear Browsing Data.



Clear cache and cookies and restart the browser.

On mobile app (Android/iOS):

Navigate to Settings > Privacy and Security > Clear Cache.



Restart the app or device afterward to reload a clean version.

4. Try a different platform or connection

Switch from app to browser or vice versa.

Try using mobile data instead of Wi-Fi, or switch to a different Wi-Fi network.

Use a VPN or proxy server if your region has inconsistent access.

5. Check rate limits

X enforces a cap of 2,400 tweets per day, with 600 DMs and 1,000 likes per day for most accounts.

If you receive a ‚ÄúYou are rate limited‚Äù error:

Wait 10 minutes and retry.



Avoid mass replying or tweeting in bursts.



Visit Settings > Account > Account Activity to monitor recent flags or suspicious behavior.

6. Use third-party tools to schedule or view posts

While the core X platform may be down, some API-based tools may still show timelines or allow scheduled posting if APIs are not completely affected.

Also read | Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra 5G is available for just Rs 40,000 on Amazon

X (formerly Twitter) experienced a widespread service outage on May 31, 2025 that affected thousands of users globally. With millions relying on X for real-time news, professional networking, brand promotion, and daily communication, such disruptions can significantly affect users‚Äô ability to engage online. The outage, which impacted critical features such as posts (tweets), replies, and direct messages (DMs), sparked a flurry of complaints and confusion across other platforms like Facebook, Instagram, Reddit, and Threads.According to Downdetector, a real-time outage monitoring website, over 35,000 incident reports were filed from the United States alone within a few hours of the issue surfacing. Many users also reported problems across Europe, Asia, and South America, pointing to a potential global-scale infrastructure problem. With digital communication increasingly becoming an essential utility, understanding the impact, technical causes, and user-side troubleshooting steps is crucial.The outage began around 11:20 AM Eastern Time and rapidly escalated. Within the first 30 minutes:Some users also experienced trouble logging into their accounts or viewing notifications.Based on aggregated user feedback:While X has not confirmed the source, experts suggest the following likely causes:Without a functioning X to express their concerns, users turned to:Many professionals lamented disruptions to brand promotions, breaking news alerts, and customer service threads, especially in industries that rely on real-time engagement.If you are currently facing issues with X, here are actionable steps you can take:
Article Summary: Users across the US, Canada, UK, Germany, India, and Brazil reported problems. Reports to Downdetector spiked from under 500 to over 35,000 in less than an hour. Key features such as posting new content and replying to existing posts were either severely delayed or entirely non-functional.

Article Title: Bengaluru‚Äôs first Apple Store likely to open soon: Store rent and more that lease agreement reveals
Article Text:
Bengaluru's 1st Apple store of 8,000 sft in Phoenix Mall of Asia

Apple India has leased a retail space of 8,000 sft in north Bengaluru's upscale Phoenix Mall of Asia for 10 years at an annual rent of Rs 2.1 cr.

The lease also includes a revenue-sharing component of 2% revenue for the first 36 months and 2.5% thereafter. However, revenue share payments are capped at twice the value of the applicable yearly minimum guaranteed rent, the document showed.

The lease commenced on November 8, 2024, and the rent will be charged from August 8, 2025, onwards. The lease has a 15% escalation in both rent and security deposit every three years.

What else do we know about Apple's retail expansion plan in India

Article Summary: Apple India has leased a retail space of 8,000 sft in north Bengaluru's upscale Phoenix Mall of Asia for 10 years at an annual rent of Rs 2.1 cr. The lease has a 15% escalation in both rent and security deposit every three years.

Article Title: 'Make Elon Musk work 40-plus hours and....': Tesla's 12 biggest shareholders send letter to Tesla board with list of 'Dos and Don'ts'
Article Text:
Elon Musk is returning to Tesla, and the company's biggest share holders have some 'do's and don't' for the CEO and company

Mandate minimum 40-hour work week commitment for Elon Musk

Establish clear CEO succession planning

Limit directors' external business commitments

Appoint truly independent board members

Powerbeats Pro 2 ‚Äì Apple‚Äôs Most Powerful Workout Buds Yet!

Tesla's major shareholders controlling 7.9 million shares have sent an urgent letter to board chair Robyn Denholm, demanding immediate action to address what they call a "crisis" at the electric vehicle maker. The coalition, including pension funds, the American Federation of Teachers, and state treasurers from New York, Oregon, and Illinois, issued four specific demands to refocus CEO Elon Musk's attention on Tesla amid declining sales and plummeting brand reputation.The shareholders blame Tesla's troubles on Musk's divided attention between the company and outside ventures, particularly his recently concluded role at the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) under the Trump administration.The investors want Tesla's board to require Musk to work at least 40 hours per week at the company as a condition of any new compensation package. This demand comes as Tesla's stock has fallen 12% this year while the Nasdaq declined only 1%. The shareholders noted that Tesla's European sales plunged nearly 50% in April compared to the previous year, and global EV sales declined in the first quarter.The letter demands a formal succession plan identifying emergency replacements for Musk should he become unavailable or lose interest in Tesla. "We believe the company's current disclosure regarding the CEO succession plan does not assure investors that the Board is adequately prepared," the shareholders wrote, emphasizing the need for qualified leadership continuity.Shareholders called for stringent policies restricting Tesla board members' involvement in other companies. They propose limiting executive directors to one additional board position and one executive role at another company, arguing this would ensure adequate time dedication to Tesla's oversight and management.The coalition demanded at least one "truly independent" director with no personal ties to existing board members. They criticized the recent appointment of former Chipotle CFO Jack Hartung, noting his son-in-law works at Tesla and his previous association with Kimbal Musk, Elon's brother who serves on Tesla's board.The shareholders attributed Tesla's reputation crisis partly to Musk's political activities, including nearly $300 million in pro-Trump donations and endorsement of Germany's far-right AfD party. Tesla has dropped from 8th to 95th place in the Axios Harris Poll of America's most admired brands.Musk announced earlier this week that his DOGE tenure had ended and pledged to focus more intensively on his businesses, including Tesla, SpaceX, and xAI. However, investors remain skeptical, with Illinois State Treasurer Michael Frerichs questioning whether Musk has learned from his mistakes or will continue prioritizing other ventures over Tesla's urgent needs.
Article Summary: Tesla's major shareholders have sent an urgent letter to board chair Robyn Denholm, demanding immediate action to address a "crisis" at the electric vehicle maker. The shareholders blame Tesla's troubles on Musk's divided attention between the company and outside ventures, particularly his recently concluded role at the Department of Government Efficiency.

Article Title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai responds to Apple senior VP Eddy Cue's claims on Safari Search's 22-year low
Article Text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai refuted Apple's claim of declining Safari search volumes, asserting that Google is experiencing overall query growth, including on Apple devices. Pichai highlighted the increasing query growth from AI Overviews and emphasized Google's commitment to directing traffic to the web, challenging other companies in the search space.
Article Summary: Google CEO Sundar Pichai refuted Apple's claim of declining Safari search volumes. He said Google is experiencing overall query growth, including on Apple devices. He highlighted the increasing query growth from AI Overviews and emphasized Google's commitment to directing traffic to the web.

Article Title: LinkedIn co-founder slams Trump administration for stopping student visa interviews: Completely forgotten how‚Ä¶
Article Text:
‚ÄúUnfortunately, the truth. Other countries are moving to fill the gap and acquire top talent. We‚Äôve completely forgotten how America prospered.‚Äù

US halts student visa interviews

Asus ROG Strix Scar 18 (2025) | 10 Features You Need to Know

LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman recently criticized the Trump administration ‚Äôs recent move to temporarily suspend all interviews for student visas, calling it a step backward for America‚Äôs long-standing tradition of attracting global talent. Responding to the policy shift, Hoffman said,Hoffman quoted an X post that read:‚ÄúBlowing a $50 billion hole in the budget of every state flagship and top private university in America. Gunshot wound to the head of the best education system in the world and the crown jewel of American soft power. Absolute madness.‚ÄùHoffman‚Äôs remarks highlight growing frustration among Silicon Valley leaders who say restricting educational access undermines America‚Äôs ability to compete globally. Many point to countries like Canada, the UK, and Australia, which are streamlining student immigration policies to attract talent that might otherwise have chosen the U.S.Earlier this week, the Trump administration said it has stopped scheduling new student visa interviews at embassies across the embassies. The order was issued by a diplomatic cable sent by US Secretary Marco Rubio .‚ÄúEffective immediately, in preparation for an expansion of required social media screening and vetting, consular sections should not add any additional student or exchange visitor (F, M and J) visa appointment capacity until further guidance is issued,‚Äù Rubio wroteThe Trump administration has defended the decision as part of a broader effort to reassess visa processing and prioritize national interest, but critics argue the suspension sends a chilling message to the world‚Äôs best and brightest.While the administration has not clarified how long the hold on interviews will last, universities and businesses are bracing for potential fallout in upcoming academic cycles.
Article Summary: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman recently criticized the Trump administration ‚Äôs recent move to temporarily suspend all interviews for student visas. Hoffman called it a step backward for America‚Äôs long-standing tradition of attracting global talent. The Trump administration has defended the decision as part of a broader effort to reassess visa processing.

Article Title: The memo that has left residents of Elon Musk‚Äôs SpaceX town in Texas 'worried'
Article Text:
Representative Image. (AP Photo/Valerie Gonzalez)

Here's the text of the memo (notice) sent to Starbase residents as reported by CNBC

May 21, 2025

Dear Starbase Property Owner/Property Occupant,

Notice is hereby given that the City Commission for the City of Starbase will conduct a Public Hearing on Monday, June 23, 2025, at 9:00 a.m., at the City of Starbase temporary city hall located at 39046 LBJ Boulevard, Brownsville, TX 78521, to hear public comments, consider and act upon the adoption of a Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance and city wide Zoning Map.

Our goal is to ensure that the zoning plan reflects the City‚Äôs vision for balanced growth, protecting critical economic drivers, ensuring public safety, and preserving green spaces. You are receiving this notice because you own the above listed property that will be located in the ‚ÄúMixed Use District‚Äù and will be impacted if the zoning ordinance is approved.

The Mixed Use District allows for a blend of residential, office, retail, and small-scale service uses. A proposed zoning map is enclosed with this notice. You may view the draft zoning ordinance on the City‚Äôs website 72 hours prior to the above listed public hearing.

The City is required by Texas law to notify you of the following: THE CITY OF STARBASE IS HOLDING A HEARING THAT WILL DETERMINE WHETHER YOU MAY LOSE THE RIGHT TO CONTINUE USING YOUR PROPERTY FOR ITS CURRENT USE, PLEASE READ THIS NOTICE CAREFULLY. The foregoing notice is required by Texas Local Government Code section 211.006(a-1). The proposed zoning ordinance is based on current and existing uses.

Please contact City Administrator Kent Myers [email address redacted] with any questions or written comments. Your written comments must be submitted by 3:00 pm on June 22, 2025. Public comments may also be given at the above listed public hearing.

Best Wishes,

Kent Myers

City Administrator, City of Starbase

[addresses redacted]

cityofstarbase-texas.com

What critics of SpaceX town say

Starbase, Texas, a small town closely tied to Elon Musk‚Äôs SpaceX, has issued a warning to some residents that they may ‚Äúlose the right to continue using‚Äù their properties as they currently do, according to a memo obtained by CNBC. The town, located in Cameron County near the Gulf Coast, is proposing a new zoning ordinance and a comprehensive citywide map, potentially reshaping the community‚Äôs landscape to accommodate SpaceX‚Äôs expanding operations.The notice, sent to property owners within a proposed ‚ÄúMixed Use District,‚Äù outlines plans to permit a blend of ‚Äúresidential, office, retail, and small-scale service uses‚Äù in the area. This shift could transform the town, which currently spans just 1.6 square miles and serves primarily as a hub for SpaceX‚Äôs ambitious Starship rocket program. The proposed zoning changes aim to integrate commercial and service-oriented developments, potentially prioritizing SpaceX‚Äôs operational needs over existing residential uses.Starbase has scheduled a public hearing on June 23, 2025, to discuss the zoning ordinance and map, offering residents a chance to voice concerns. The notice was signed by Kent Myers, Starbase‚Äôs newly appointed city administrator, who recently assumed the role, according to ValleyCentral.com. Neither Starbase officials nor SpaceX responded to CNBC‚Äôs requests for further details on Thursday, leaving residents with limited information about the potential impact.Incorporated earlier this month as a ‚Äútype-C municipal corporation‚Äù following a local election heavily influenced by SpaceX, Starbase is now governed by a mix of current and former SpaceX employees. The town‚Äôs formation marks a significant milestone for Musk‚Äôs aerospace company, which has transformed the area since establishing its launch facility in 2014. Starbase‚Äôs population, estimated at around 500 as of early 2025, includes approximately 260 SpaceX employees, with most other residents being their relatives, per the Texas Tribune.Starbase held its inaugural city commission meeting this week, marking its first formal step as a municipality. The meeting followed closely after the Starship test, highlighting the town‚Äôs dual identity as both a residential community and a corporate stronghold for SpaceX. The proposed zoning changes could further align Starbase‚Äôs development with SpaceX‚Äôs long-term objectives, including plans to expand its launch facilities and support infrastructure.Critics, including some local advocacy groups, have raised concerns about the rapid transformation of Starbase, citing potential environmental impacts and the risk of prioritizing corporate interests over residents‚Äô rights. The area‚Äôs proximity to the Boca Chica State Park and its ecologically sensitive wetlands has also drawn scrutiny from environmentalists, who worry about the effects of increased development.As Starbase prepares for the June 23 hearing, residents are bracing for changes that could redefine their community. The outcome of the zoning ordinance will likely signal whether Starbase remains a company town centered on SpaceX‚Äôs ambitions or evolves into a more balanced community with diverse land uses. For now, the town remains a unique experiment in corporate-driven urban planning, with Elon Musk‚Äôs vision for space exploration at its core.
Article Summary: Starbase, Texas, a small town closely tied to Elon Musk‚Äôs SpaceX, has issued a warning to some residents that they may ‚Äúlose the right to continue using‚Äù their properties as they currently do. The town, located in Cameron County near the Gulf Coast, is proposing a new zoning ordinance and a comprehensive citywide map. The notice, sent to property owners within a proposed ‚ÄúMixed Use District,‚Äù outlines plans to permit a blend of ‚Äúresidential, office, retail, and small- scale service uses‚Äù in the area.

Article Title: How this $7,000 EV is said to be busting the 'biggest' myth about cars in Japan and is set to beat Toyota in EV sales
Article Text:
In a country where EVs are still a rare sight, KG Motors is trying to bust a burgeoning myth: That Bigger is Better.

A Japanese startup, KG Motors, is aiming to boost Japan's electric vehicle (EV) market with an ultra-compact, affordable one-seater EV called the mibot, according to Bloomberg. Resembling a futuristic golf cart, the mibot is designed for Japan's narrow streets and has already pre-sold over half of the 3,300 units planned for delivery in 2027. This puts KG Motors on track to surpass Toyota, which sold around 2,000 EVs in Japan in 2024. Production is set to begin in October at a new factory east of Hiroshima.Japan‚Äôs EV market lags globally, with EVs making up just 3.5% of vehicle sales in 2023 compared to the global average of 18%, per BloombergNEF. Toyota‚Äôs multi-pathway approach, favoring hybrids alongside EVs, has shaped public skepticism about EVs‚Äô popularity, Kusunoki noted. However, small kei cars like the Sakura, which sold nearly 23,000 units in 2024, dominate Japan‚Äôs EV market.KG Motors‚Äô mibot, with its minimalist design and low production costs, targets rural areas with declining public transport. Bloomberg reports that 95% of the 2,250 pre-orders come from homeowners with at least one vehicle. The startup expects to break even on its second batch of 3,000 units and aims to produce 10,000 annually thereafter.
